Class Server.ThreadHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server.ThreadHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    Server

    private static class Server.ThreadHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

    A ThreadHandler receives messages or commands from a client and make responses.

    Before a client can enter the chat room, he/she will be required to enter a user name. After the ThreadHandler validates the name, a feedback will be given to the client.
    If the name is valid, the client will be allowed to talk in the chat room or send requests to the server.

      Has the client decided to finish the chat?
      private java.io.BufferedReader in
      Reads text from InputStream.
      private boolean nameValidated
      Has the name of client been validated?
      In this chat room, only the clients whose names have been validated are considered formal users.
      private java.io.PrintWriter out
      Prints text to OutputStream.
      private java.lang.String userName
      The name of the client.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Broadcasts chat messages to all clients.
        Responds to client requests.
        Before those, the ThreadHandler needs to validate the user name first.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        See Also:
        Runnable.run()

      • processCommand

        public void processCommand(java.lang.String userInput)
        Processes the request commands and call the corresponding methods to deal with them.
        Parameters:
        userInput - the whole command, starting with "- "

      • showHelp

        public void showHelp()
        Shows all the request commands the client can send to the server.
        If the client is an Administrator, he will have two extra commands.

      • getPastTime

        public java.lang.String getPastTime(long startTime)
        Gets the past time between a start time and now.
        Parameters:
        startTime - a start time
        Returns:
        the past time in a specific format

      • feedback

        public void feedback(java.lang.String content)
        (The Server) gives a feedback to the client who sends it a request.
        Parameters:
        content - the message the server wants to send to the client

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(java.lang.String content,
                      java.lang.String sender)

        Broadcasts a message to all other clients.

        There are two kinds of broadcasts, one is the server's broadcast and another is the client's broadcast.
        Parameters:
        content - the content to be broadcast
        sender - "Server" or a client's name

      • getClientsNumber

        public void getClientsNumber()
        Shows the client the number of people who are currently connected to the chat room.

      • getServerIP

        public void getServerIP()
        Shows the client the server's IP Address.

        Shows the client how long the server has been running for.

        public void getStayingTime()
        Shows the client how long he/she has been in the chat room for.

      • block

        public void block(java.lang.String userInput)

        Blocks all the messages from another client with his/her name.

        The client can also unblock another client.

        An additional functionality.

        Parameters:
        userInput - the whole command, "-block [name]"

      • unBlock

        public void unBlock(java.lang.String userInput)
        Unblocks another client (receive messages from him/her again).
        Parameters:
        userInput - the whole command, "-unblock [a name]"

      • privateMsg

        public void privateMsg(java.lang.String userInput)

        Sends a private message to another client.

        The message is only visible to the receiver and the sender.

        An additional functionality.
        Parameters:
        userInput - the whole command, "-private [a name] [message content]"

      • clearScreen

        public void clearScreen()
        Clears the client's screen by simply printing out 50 empty lines.

      • verifyAdmin

        public void verifyAdmin(java.lang.String userInput)

        Verify the administrator password entered by the client.

        An additional functionality.
        Parameters:
        userInput - the whole command, "-admin [a password]"

      • kick

        public void kick(java.lang.String userInput)

        Kicks a user out of the chat room, which is one of the privileges of Administrator.

        To use it, the client needs to first become an Administrator.

        An additional functionality.
        Parameters:
        userInput - the whole command, "-kick [a name]"

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
        Shuts down the server, which is a privilege of the Administrator.

        To use it, the client needs to first become an Administrator.

        An additional functionality.
